name: Solage Calistoga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my second time at Solage. First time was a girls trip, this time with my husband. They have 3 pools, kids, adult and at the spa. Service at the adult pool was excellent, from being greeted, brought ice water and a carafe which the staff would stop by and poor refills of water from. The lunch options were good and they had nice strong drinks. The fish tacos were quite good. The room had a nice patio with comfortable furniture and a branch covered awning giving it a Eco friendly feeling. The patio overlooked a wooded area and was very peaceful. Great for reading a book, having a glass of wine and some cheese. The complimentary bottle of Cabernet wasn't bad. The inside of the room had a large flat screen t.v., 2 leather chairs and a table at the end of the bed. The bed was not very comfortable, it was too hard. There's also a desk and chair. On the other side of the wall that the bed is against, is the bathroom. There's a large tub, large stone floored shower but only a single sink in the bathroom. There's a separate commode room. There is also a minbar, coffee maker and at night during turn down service they bring mint leaf infused bottles of water. The restaurant was excellent for breakfast. One day I had the lemon ricotta pine nut pancakes with blueberry syrup and fresh blueberries. So good! The other morning I had the continental that included hose made granola that was atop of the yogurt. there was also fresh fruit and a muffin. The fruit had blueberries, raspberries, plums, nectarines and pineapple. Not the boring standard fruit that many resorts and hotels do. It also included juice and French pressed coffee or tea. For lunch we had The Lucky Pig which included sesame crepes, butter leaf lettuce to be used as wraps for the fall apart pork. Accompaniments included, spiced peanuts, jalapeños, noodle/cucumber slaw and a spicy sauce to top it off. Unusual and good but too much food for lunch. I would recommend having it for dinner in their lounge area. For dinner we started with the la plancha shrimp and the fried green tomatoes topped with shrimp and avocado. I had the Alaskan halibut which was perfectly cooked. The next night I had the truffle stuffing, stuffed chicken. At the spa I had a raspberry lemonade scrub and massage, which was nice and relaxing. After breakfast we would ride bikes around the property. Each room had two courtesy bikes to be used by the guests. Fun and added to the Eco friendly environment. When we were checking out, the bell men kindly placed bottled water in our vehicles. It's an upscale resort with all the amenities and services but manages to maintain an unpretentious laid back vibe. I would absolutely stay here again!
reviews.title: Relaxing At Solage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013
reviews.text: This hotel is so good that you do not want to leave. The views are amazing, the rooms very comfortable and spacious, the spa is excellent and everything is very tastefully designed. There are two free bikes if you want to explore a bit
reviews.title: Heaven on earth

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spend 3 nights in this paradise after a week in SFO. High price but each dollars are not spend for nothing. The value are excellent.
reviews.title: Wonderful place

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good food specilaly for the dinner. Nice pool and really good spa. The room are comfortable and clean.
reviews.title: Incredible service in beautiful surroundings.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled on business
reviews.text: Our experience here was wonderful. The reception staff were helpful and friendly, as we're the pool staff, the girls who cleaned our rooms, the restaurant staff , the spa staff and the gym staff. All the staff made us feel welcome and well looked after.
reviews.title: Great pool

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: It was quite last minute but we joined friends who were staying there for drinks and we were able to get a last-remaining suite at the last minute. Let me tell you, I was extremely impressed. Each room is it's own cottage. Even though two cottages are together, it is their living rooms (for the suites anyway) that butt up against the other. The outdoor jacuzzi was very private and also out of eyesight of any neighbors. The bikes at each cottage was such in interesting touch! The staff is happy to have you use them either on the grounds or to take them off on your own adventure. Each room was very nicely appointed in a very contemporary, simple yet complete way. We were surprised at just how well they had used the space. Bathrooms were huge, indoor sauna. The staff was fabulous! All very kind and friendly. No request too huge and they were always willing to do whatever it took to satisfy the customer. My advice, make sure to stay at least 2 days so that you can really experience the relaxation intended. This is not an overnighter place. I know that some have given less than glowing reviews but I don't know what that's about. They've been open for six months and may have been working through some issues. Our friends did have a slight mix up but the hotel went above and beyond in trying to correct the situation.
reviews.title: Couldn't have asked for more

likes.liked: — The fantastic staff, the well-appointed rooms
likes.disliked: — The spa store did not have many products, particularly those used in the room, for purchase

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Our family is currently enjoying a 5 day getaway at this resort. We felt compelled to write a review because of previous comments. Clearly they do not appreciate the environmental efforts made by this resort, one of which is sustainable landscaping! We were pleasantly surprised after only being opened 4 months with not only the amount of landscaping but the variety as well. The attention to detail cannot be matched. The spa, the gym, the free exercise classes and the complimentary bikes at our room are incredible. Not to mention the Solbar restaurant which is among the best resort restaurants we have experienced. We have yet to encounter a member of the staff or management that has not been extremely helpful and friendly. Our past experiences in traveling have been with Four Seasons and the Ritz Carlton. I would choose this resort over them any day.
reviews.title: Perfect Getaway

likes.liked: — cleaniness and size of the room, private

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at Solage on Halloween and contrary to some reviews posted here it wasn't scary at all. I was warmly greeted by name upon check-in and given all of the information needed to ensure I would enjoy all of the resort amenities.
reviews.title: Fun and New!

likes.disliked: — Too much gym equipment made me feel guilty for not working out. :(

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled with family
reviews.text: Unfortunately, I didn't have a chance to dine at Solbar for dinner, but the Front Desk agent politely offered to make a reservation for me if I didn't already have plans. Bellmen escort you to your room on bikes and gave me a full tour of the room. I liked the fact the resort was brand new...everything was clean and sparkling. The decor isn't Motel 6, it's a simple aesthetic that fits in with and enhances the surrounding environment.
reviews.title: Solage -- The Best Resort in Napa Valley
What a fabulous resort
reviews.text: To me, Solage seemed a good value for the price and I was really happy with my stay. Next time I will be sure to try a spa treatment and will definitely bring my workout clothes.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed here while planning our wedding at their sister resort, Auberge Du Soleil, which is a much higher (and more expensive) hotel.
reviews.title: Threadbare luxury, Hotel is Good-Not Great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We loved the idea of having our own semi-detached studio cottage in a Green resort.
reviews.title: Lovely. What's not to like?!?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food was solid but not spectacular.
reviews.title: Amazing in Every Way

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The pool was OK, but directly across from the restaurant.
reviews.title: Hotel is fine, spa is great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: We took advantage of the new-vintage-style bikes and rode into the local town (not much to see there)
reviews.title: Perfect stay. Amazing hotel and staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I'm a local to the Bay Area, and we enjoy heading up to Napa for short trips at high end places like Solage. So I feel I can give a good, balanced comparison of some options you may be cross-shopping up here for your trip.
reviews.title: Comparing Napa Villa-style accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: There are three resorts we have visited that all seem to target a similar market/demographic. Solage is the newest of these three, and is targeting a price-range between, say, $500-$1000 per night in individual free-standing "studios", with lots of nice facilities and luxury.
reviews.title: Wonderful Getaway

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The closest comparison is probably The Carneros Inn on the extreme opposite end of the Valley. Of the two, I think Solage is the winner. Its smaller and more intimate, and I think has the better location. Price-wise I think they tend to come out about the same. Both are clearly following the same template - modern-style construction, individual rooms, nice pool area, spa, restaurant, good service. I think Solage has the nicer spa, a few more nice service features, and a nicer little corner of the valley it occupies.
reviews.title: Best Resort!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the same operator and slightly higher-cost is Calistoga Ranch. Its a true "sister property" located a short hop away on the same road, but the focus at Calistoga Ranch is definitely more about privacy and pleasant surroundings, and less about the restaurant, spa, or pool facilities (although it has all those things). Calistoga Ranch is a bit older property, and a bit costlier generally.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: For me, Calistoga Ranch is a very unique and relaxing place. The room designs are very unique with two portions of the room separated by an outdoor space, private hot-tubs, etc. And the sloped property with old growth trees, really feels like you've escaped everything. And its a smaller property which means more individual service, and more attention from the concierge.
reviews.title: Love the modern touches in a traditional setting

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Went to the Hotel after quitting the noisy River Inn at Napa and drove a reasonable bargain $275 per night.The rooms are at least self contained and quiet but I have to agree with other travellers that in winter the concrete floors are just too damned cold.The resort and rooms are quite luxurious and we stayed happily for 5 nights enjoying Calistoga and the area, the food in Solage was not particularly good on the one night we ate there so we ate in the town and the spa at the resort was so expensive it took our breath away and we aint poor.We walked Mt.St. Helena which was a glorious experience and particularly enjoyed the eating out at Brannons with the music of Herb and his colleagues unmissable.We will return but won't use the spa unless they ameliorate their pricing.
reviews.title: getting there

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: My husband and I recently returned from a 2 night stay at Solage resort in Calistoga. I would def. return. We went knowing relatively nothing about the place - no recommendations from anyone, at least. First impressions not great. At first glance, it looked like a housing tract. "Oh no, we're staying there?"
reviews.title: Loved this newish Calistoga resort

likes.liked: — Newness, the staff and the individual bungalows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Impressions quickly changed. Everyone at the resort was very friendly and helpful. The tract housing look was an eco friendly thing. Lots of olive trees and drought tolerant plants. Also, the resort is less than a year old. Plants may not be fully grown in yet.
reviews.title: Creative, fun and relaxing experience

likes.liked: — Overall attention to detail across the entire hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Resort consists of individual bungalows with 2 beach cruiser bikes provided for getting around or taking into town. The town of Calistoga is a very quick bike ride away.
reviews.title: A Wonderful Retreat

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Interior of the rooms were very nice with individual patios and comfy beds. The restaurant on-site named Solbar was very good. We had a delicious dinner and breakfast.
reviews.title: Outstanding, exceeded expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: This hotel was spectacular. The grounds are impeccable, guestroom accommodations comfortable, spacious and perfect. The staff couldn't be more accommodating and generous. The food and beverage was phenomenal. The spa unbelievable and the pools amazing. Every room comes with bicycles which is so great as the town is a 10 minute bike ride away. Highly recommend this hotel for a romantic getaway, business meeting, girls/spa weekend...anything!
reviews.title: 2 days in Paradise

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We visited Spa Solage at the Solage Calistoga resort on our recent girlfriend getaway to Napa. We each booked a spa sampler that included a mudslide treatment, body scrub and massage. The spa was extremely clean and the staff friendly, professional and efficient. The spa area was very relaxing and the food we ordered while enjoying the Bathhouse and pool area was delicious---service was slow considering the area didn't appear extremely busy. The grounds were beautiful and I am seriously considering staying here on my next visit to Napa, but even if I don't, I'll definitely book a spa treatment on my next visit. It was simply refreshing and my skin still feels amazing 5 weeks later!
reviews.title: Most amazing spa experience of my life!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at Solage for 2 nights, a Sunday and Monday night. I think staying on these nights proved to be beneficial as far as crowds go. We pretty much had the Bathhouse to ourselves the whole time! May be it was luck of timing, who knows.
reviews.title: Fantastic Kid Free Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We got the Soak up Summer package, which included breakfast and 100 credit and a room upgrade.
reviews.title: Great place to stay - outstanding food!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Our experience at the Sol Bar was not great on Sunday night, the girl serving us seemed more interested in "upselling" at every point, than worrying about getting the food and drinks we actually ordered to us!! We ended up leaving without a drink we ordered, even though she repeated it to my husband and asked me if I wanted one, even though I am obviously pregnant!!!
reviews.title: Traded relaxation for stressful experience :-((

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: We came here to celebrate special birthdays and it was a very memorable weekend. Solage is such an exquisite resort - the grounds are beautiful. Tons of privacy with your own cottage - lovely outdoor patios. Loved the 2 bikes just for our use . Fitness center was wonderful -good classes. the food at the Solbar restaurant was noteworthy. Loved all the outdoor fire and water features to sit by in the evening. Nice .8 mile walk into town of Calistoga. Would definitely come back!
reviews.title: Solage was fabulous!
Weakest Auberge Property
reviews.text: I am a frequent guest of other Auberge properties and am deeply disappointed with this property. I have had so many wonderful stays with Auberge that my expectations are that all of their properties are similar in quality and service. The room that we were given was next door to another guests room that had barking dogs. The dogs would not stop and I felt that we were at a dog kennel. I called the front desk to ask for a different room. It took 30 minutes for us to switch after we waited 4 hours to get our first room. The property only had one bellman and one person at the front desk during peak season. The service needs to come up a lot to meet the level of other Auberge properties.

reviews.title: Wonderful relaxing experience
reviews.text: The property itself has no character and feels like you are at a summer camp for kids.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent 3 nights here as part of a two week California road trip, this was our chilling time. We took advantage of the outdoor activities because of the fabulous weather so did not use the fitness centre or spa. We used the bikes to go to town and also out to local wineries. Most of the roads have bike lanes so it felt safe. We also enjoyed swimming in the amazing pool. Solbar was fabulous, we had dinner one night and breakfast every morning. We had planned to go to town for breakfast some mornings but it was so good it pulled us back. Around the pool the service was very attentive. Our room was perfect, spacious and calming decor. The hotel is close enough to walk into town, but a flashlight is useful for the walk home in the evening. The only thing I would have changed is the timing of our visit. If you don't have to go at the weekend it is so much quieter during the week. The car park was very busy when we arrived Friday evening and when we got to the pool on Saturday at 4pm we had to wait for some people to leave to get sun beds, on Sunday we spent most of the day by the pool and it was never more than 25% occupied as so many people had checked out. All of the staff were friendly and seeking to ensure their guests had a good time. It may be a while but we will be back
reviews.title: Solage Calistoga ~RAVE reviews

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my third choice when booking travel and I choose them because of their mineral pools and mud bath over the top 2 choices. And I am 100% pleased with my decision. They go above and beyond to make your stay enjoyable and hassle free. I felt like royalty. I will be coming back to Solgae many times in my future. I was truly amazed. And I have traveled the world over and stayed at the finest accommodations.
reviews.title: Still dreaming about Solage.. can't wait to come back!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I have to agree with every comment that posted about this hotel.
reviews.title: Do yourself a favor...Do Not Stay At Solage

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This had to be one of the worst experiences in the hotel industry. I travel all over the world and stay at Four Seasons and Ritz-Carlton and thought by the advertisements that I would receive that level of service and ambiance. Well....if you are looking for service they have a long way to go....Just opening is no excuse as I have stayed at numerous Ritz-Carltons after opening and the service was top notch. Motel 6 does a better job than this place. No one seems to have a clue as to what they are doing. The management I think is more clueless than the line staff. The restaurant was horrible. It was the most bland menu I have ever experienced. No flavor.....just because you are green doesn't mean it has to taste bad! The rooms.....hmmmm where do you want me to begin....the concrete floors are freezing, the minimalistic decor is going to be dated in a year or so, the bathroom with no light privacy HUGE Issue...the patio that looks at everything in the resort and the poorly landscaped grounds....It looks like CAMP. My friends said it right when they said it reminded them of a Methodist retreat. Not to mention the event space that is right by all the rooms...Could you imagine if they were having an event? The entire resort would hear everything. They have this big white barn thing and if there was an event in there unless you rented out the entire grounds......you would be miserable if you wanted to go there to relax....It is just a joke. I would NEVER go back.....You have to wonder about the management....Oh...one last thing...there follow through is the pits. There famous answer is let us give you a call....the phone never rang unless it was someone from their staff dialing the wrong room...again ANNOYING...all in all....I don't know how this place is going to make it! I would think once, twice three times before waisting a dollar at Solage Calistoga -5 Stars
reviews.title: Look at the user photos before you decide

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We booked a stay at the Solage within a few weeks after it opened. We've stayed in Napa/Sonoma in the past, and have high expectations. We love hotels with a contemporary feel, and, looking at the Solage website and talking with the staff, we thought it would be great.
reviews.title: Great option--hip, relaxing and progressive!

likes.liked: — Cruiser Bikes, Mineral Pool, Design and cleanliness of rooms

reviews.title: bad
reviews.text: Shortly before the trip, a staff member contacted us, and talked up the grounds -- explaining how wonderful they were, and how we wouldn't ever leave the property once we got there. The hotel's photos seemed to show a nicely-landscaped lux property.

reviews.title: Solage: some things to think about.
reviews.text: Solage is a semi-urban resort located in Calistoga, CA. Solage appeals as a venue for weddings, conferences, spa treatments and family vacations.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Solage's strong points are its Spa, Solbar restaurant for dinner (but not breakfast), Olympic size pool, guest bicycles for getting around and local excursions, and hassle-free access to their Mercedes-Benz convertibles (up to 4 hours!) for a delightful spin down Silverado Trail. It should also be mentioned that Solage staff are attentive without being intrusive. The resort provides excellent, free wifi coverage.
reviews.title: love solage!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Solage is less appealing to those who wish a high degree of privacy and "elbow-room", or who are primarily interested in exploring Napa wineries. If you fall among the former, the (sister) Calistoga Ranch is probably a better choice. Or, if you are really bent on tapping into Solage, avoid high-season and "events" (weekend wedding receptions), when elbow-room and after-hours privacy shrink.
reviews.title: no words enough to describe a dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The cabin/studios are smart, spacious, modern but lack the Arts and Crafts charm of, say, the sea ranch cottages at the Travaasa Hotel Hana. I found the ceiling fan an excellent substitute to running the air conditioner and the sound dampening of the French doors was much better than expected. The tea pot is excellent, but the coffee maker and coffee are just average. Mattresses are excellent. Units all appear to have patios with lovely rough branch topped pergolas and many are situated to look on lovely old oak trees. Units in the 50's range are close to Silverado Trail, so the outdoor experience is marred by the noise of traffic. On the far side of the resort, units in the 70's and 80s' (and others) are within site of two-story walkup apartments. Those in the 60's range may be the most ideal.
reviews.title: Good location, big rooms, room to spread out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Of course this proximity to Calistoga makes it easy to walk or bike to the old town. I suggest you exit via the Brannan street gate. If you are on bike, continue across Lincoln Street to Grant Street, continuing down Grant and then Myrtledale Road to the Geyser at Tubbs Lane. Quiet and not too much traffic. The more adventurous may be inclined to bike down Silverado trail, a bit challenging with one-speed bikes. The trip to Lommel Road and back should take about an hour.
reviews.title: Great Service, fair accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008
reviews.text: Stayed 2 nights at Solage while wine tasting in Napa. I booked a studio several weeks in advance directly with the property, and found a cheaper rate on their website a week before my arrival, so called up and they adjusted the rate without a fuss.
reviews.title: Unique lodging, very pleased

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: The property is very unique. It consists of a bunch of single level "apartments" set in a cul-de-sac style complex. My unit was joined with one other, but otherwise the units are separated (didn't hear any noise from my neighbors). The patio area has 2 seats, but no privacy so you end up looking at other patio areas (some units did have a fence for privacy). Some grass would be a welcome addition, but I didn't mind all the gravel and brown sand.
reviews.title: Nice addition to Calistoga

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: As others have noted, inside the floors are concrete with the exception of a small area rug beneath the bed, so I'd encourage guests to bring flip flops for use in the apartment (they do provide a complimentary pair of slippers). The pebble shower was fantastic, and the sink/bathroom areas were simple and clean. Bed was comfy, breakfast at their restaurant was good, and the staff was friendly. Had a couples mud bath at their spa, which basically involved spreading mud on each other and baking in a room for 20 minutes, followed by a soak in a mineral bath and 20 minutes in a vibrating chair with headphones and relaxing music. Mud baking was just ok, but I enjoyed the soak and the chair.
reviews.title: Diamond in the making! Auberge makes the best!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I return, I'll opt for a bigger unit next time, mostly because of the fact the bed sits several feet from both the main door and the sliding glass door. I believe larger units have a wall separating the bed from the living area, and as mentioned above, I think some have a fence for privacy on the patio. All in all, a good stay and launching spot for some wine tasting.
reviews.title: Very Nice

likes.liked: — The room was very roomy and had a great bed!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I just spent two nights at Solage Calistoga, and for all intents and purposes, it is a great resort. It just opened last July, and the landscaping is drought-resistent, meaning sparse, but I am told they are going to invest in the landscaping to make it more aesthetically pleasing. The food was great, although a bit slow for breakfast, even though the dining room was empty. The bed was wonderful, and I loved the pebble stone shower floor. Our room did not have a tub, which was a bit confusing since they promote themselves as a hiking-biking-walking resort that you come back to your room and relax. The spa was fantastic, and being able to bike into Calistoga is a huge plus. Overall, I would recommend it.
reviews.title: A Trendy Chic Stay in Calistoga

likes.liked: — The room layout and patio area and bikes
likes.disliked: — concrete floors and no double sink area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything at Solage was outstanding, from the spectacular pool to the courteous and efficient staff to the wonderful food. We stayed a week, much of it in or by the pool. Great yoga classes and massage therapists, too. The rooms are very comfortable and very well-designed, so that even though you are next to others you'd never know, even on your patio. All the staff were eager to see that we had a great time, and we did. Can't wait to go back!
reviews.title: What a perfect spot!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Solage Calistoga is a perfect combination of quenching cocktails,awesome food,peaceful relaxation,indulging spa treatments at a picturesque beautiful property. The rooms are stocked with everything you need and make you feel like it is not a hotel room but your own personal space. The food has a combination of multiple layers of flavoring and subtleness of flavors. There are also other treats that you will find at Solage Calistoga......
reviews.title: Perfection

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Solage is an upscale spa located in a beautiful area of the wine country. The accomodations and service are fabulous. The restaurant on the property, Sol Bar, serves excellent food. The main pool is a little too large, just a very long rectangle. The grounds could be landscaped a little nicer, but overall Solage is really a special experience. It is a little pricey but worth the extra money if you are celebrating a special occasion or just want to get away.
reviews.title: Wine Country Spa
Not worth the money
reviews.text: Let me start off by saying I'm not writing this review so someone from the hotel can contact me and offer me a discount.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I honestly can't see myself staying here again given the fact that there are so many other beautiful high end places to stay in the Napa Valley.
reviews.title: beyond our expectations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was my boyfriend and I's second trip to Napa within 6 months. The first time we stayed at Hotel Yountville, which far exceeded our expectations. Sadly, this time, we decided to try something different and stayed at Solage. After staying at Hotel Yountville, and many similar luxury hotels in other parts of the US and the world the past year, this is the first time we have left utterly disgusted and disappointed. Everything lacked at this hotel from its amenities to its service, and all the small details in-between.
reviews.title: Disappointment!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: First of all, don't plan eating after 9 on a weekday, or 9:30 on a weekend. My flight had been delayed our first night there and we had reservations at Solbar we knew we wouldn't be in time for. We called to discuss our options and were told as a very matter of fact, they would not have anything there for us to eat after 9, but "they could make us a simple sandwich and leave it in the room" for us. We declined and grabbed dinner in San Fran which was our last delicious and easy meal before Solage.
reviews.title: Beautiful and peaceful
Overrated
reviews.text: When we arrived a little past 9 Thursday we asked what time the bar closed. We had just traveled and it would have been nice to kick off our vacation with a cocktail. We were informed there was no set time it closed, just when patrons left for the evening. We then asked the gentleman showing us to our room if we had enough time drop off our belongings, or if we should just go straight to the bar? He confidently answered we would have enough time. We were gone for 5 minutes and when we came back we literally saw them just lock the door. We were not able to enjoy a cocktail or dinner that night. On top of that, none of their other amenities are open past 8 - not a pool, not a hot tub, nothing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled with family
reviews.text: Since there was nothing else to do at the hotel, and no other close by entertainment in Calistoga, we went back to our room and decided to order a movie. You guessed it. Movies are not available to order in the rooms. We called room service to make sure we weren't missing something. They informed us they would bring us a piece of paper with a list of movies on it. They would leave it with us to select a movie, then we should call and they would bring us the DVD. When we got the list it was outdated and quite a few weren't available. We gave up at that point and looked for the mini bar. We came to Napa for wine and found they had pretty much everything but that. So keep in mind if you must stay here, you may want to bring your own bottle.
reviews.title: Gets better everytime

reviews.text: Without writing 5 more paragraphs, their pool was dirty. It had dead bugs, leaves and debris at the bottom. So many in fact, we decided to use their "geothermal" pool they cool down so much it feels like a semi- warm bath tub water and the smell of chlorine doesn't assist with the ambiance either.
